page.title: 14Churches
page.content: St. Peter's Church, Ilmer, is one of the oldest in the Diocese of Oxford, dating back to the 12th Century. Some of it is Norman, but much was rebuilt in the old perpendicular style about 1350. The bell turret retains the original timber framing covered by modern weather boarding and pyramidal roof and spire are covered in oak shingles. After much effort Â£8000 was raised a few years ago in less than two years to reshingle the roof, repair the tower and restore the bells. The benefice is held jointly with St.Mary's Princes Risborough. Owlswick Chapel is a well cared for building dating back to the Civil Wars, when the previous one was destroyed. It seats about 40 people and there are two services a month. It comes under the parish of Monks Risborough.
